Posts.Content: Hi dad! Glad to see you on the forum! Newporter, how do you find a support group? And those in your support group that has salvage radiation, was it effective for a while? What about a PET scan? Has anyone had one of these to locate the mets? Thanks!

Posts.Title: My dad

Posts.Content: Age : 79 1/2 RPR : Nov., 2010 Gleason score after surgical path : 9 No nodal involvement but tumor invading perineural capsules bilaterally PSA pre-op : 5.6 PSA 6 weeks post-op : 3.4 Lupron, Casodex started; radiation refused per my dad PSA has been undetectable for 3 years since Lupron began until Oct. 2013 : 0.01 PSA two weeks ago : 1.2 We went to a new urologist yesterday (the other retired) and he had not even looked over all the information sent him. We are set to see an oncologist and radiation oncologist after a PSA redraw in 3 weeks. Casodex was stopped. Has anyone been in a similar situation and the withdrawal of Casodex helped lower the PSA? How bad are the side effects with radiation? I would sure appreciate any thoughts or comments on the position my dad is in. And if anyone has been "here" and can give insights as to what to expect. Thanks so much. We are in unchartered territory now.
Posts.Title: My dad
